page.title: 03Population of the Wolfords
page.content: The distribution of population in Great Wolford and Todenham shows a similar pattern. About 50% are of working age and 25% each below 16 and above retirement age. The pattern is slightly different in Little Wolford - 66% of working age, 23% under 16 and 11% over 60. The villages are becoming popular as places of retirement, with an increasingly elderly population - Todenham has 13 above 75 years old out of a total of 173. On the other hand, there has been a welcome increase in the number of children in Great Wolford recently - now 30, including one set of Quads, making 9 children under five out of a total of 145. Little Wolford, with a total of 91, has 3 under 5. Another feature is the changing population. In Great Wolford over half the households have lived there for less than 10 years.
